item.title: 私募股权公司涌入垃圾债市场为自己买单
item.description: 私募股权公司在为其投资项目寻找买家的过程中举步维艰，它们正前所未有地求助于一种古老的玩法。【原文：Private equity firms, struggling to find buyers for their investments, are turning to an old playbook like never before.】

item.title: 瑞士央行施莱格尔称瑞士通胀率将在未来数月回升
item.description: 瑞士国家银行行长马丁-施莱格尔（Martin Schlegel）表示，瑞士的消费价格增长有望略有加快。【原文：Consumer-price growth in Switzerland is expected to accelerate a bit, according to Swiss National Bank President Martin Schlegel.】

item.title: 哈佛大学遭黑客攻击，常春藤联盟网络攻击最新案例
item.description: 哈佛大学校友、捐赠者、部分学生和教师的数据库在受到电话钓鱼攻击后被 "未经授权的一方 "访问，这是常春藤盟校受到的最新网络攻击，也是哈佛大学今年第二次调查漏洞事件。【原文：A Harvard University database of alumni, donors, some students and faculty was accessed by “an unauthorized party” after a phone phishing attack, the latest cyberattack on Ivy League schools and the second time Harvard has investigated a breach this year.】

item.title: 美联储观察家转向计票，12 月利率大戏愈演愈烈
item.description: 最近几周，美联储内部的分歧愈演愈烈，官员们在央行12月的政策会议前各持己见，而主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔则保持沉默。【原文：Division at the Federal Reserve has intensified in recent weeks, with officials staking out disparate positions ahead of the central bank’s December policy meeting — all while Chair Jerome Powell stays silent.】

item.title: 房利美和房地美股价模仿 "备忘录股票 "狂热波动
item.description: 比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）点燃了这把火，而比尔-普尔特（Bill Pulte）则为这把火增添了动力。【原文：Bill Ackman lit the fire and Bill Pulte supercharged it.】

item.title: 零售股需要不太可能出现的假日奇迹来挽救 2025 年的颓势
item.description: 美国消费者正步入假期旺季。【原文：The American consumer is limping into the holiday season.】

item.title: 泰国央行认为有降息空间，希望泰铢走软
item.description: 泰国新任央行行长表示，泰铢应该走弱以反映经济基本面，而且还有进一步放宽货币政策的空间。【原文：Thailand’s newly-appointed central bank governor says the baht should be weaker to reflect economic fundamentals, and there is room to ease monetary policy further.】

item.title: 阿联酋计划向非洲人工智能基础设施投资 10 亿美元
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国计划投资 10 亿美元，在非洲各地扩展人工智能基础设施和服务，加强其对非洲大陆的影响力，因为非洲大陆在采用人工智能技术方面落后于世界其他地区。【原文：The United Arab Emirates plans to invest $1 billion to expand artificial intelligence infrastructure and services across Africa, bolstering its influence on a continent that’s lagged behind the rest of the world in adopting the technology.】

item.title: 加密货币本月的暴跌引发华尔街压力测试
item.description: 对于比特币死忠来说，命运逆转已经不是什么新鲜事了。每隔几年就会发生一次，或者每当情绪崩溃时也会发生。【原文：Reversals of fortune are nothing new for Bitcoin diehards — euphoric rallies, then brutal selloffs. They happen every few years, or whenever sentiment snaps.】

item.title: Wi-Fi 巨头越南工厂引发中国分裂问题
item.description: 在中国成立的 Wi-Fi 巨头 TP-Link 系统公司正试图说服美国国家安全官员相信它独立于中国政府。该公司在越南的工厂生产运往美国的产品，围绕该工厂的情况表明，要做到这一点可能有多难。【原文：China-founded Wi-Fi behemoth TP-Link Systems Inc. is trying to convince US national security officials it’s independent from Beijing. The circumstances surrounding its Vietnam factory, where the company makes products to ship to the US, show how hard that may be.】

item.title: 南希-佩洛西 2022 年的台湾之行如何帮助日本决定重新开火
item.description: 历史一次又一次地证明了意外后果的力量。【原文：Time and again, history shows the power of unintended consequences.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德称货币政策无法解决债务问题
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）警告说，不要将货币政策视为解决债务问题的办法，并含蓄地拒绝了法国极右翼政党最近提出的该机构应重新启动大规模资产购买的建议。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde warned against seeing monetary policy as a solution to debt problems, implicitly rejecting recent suggestions from France’s far-right party that the institution should relaunch large-scale asset purchases.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：美国就业增长超出预期
item.description: 美国 9 月份的就业增长超过了预期，而失业率却有所上升，这说明劳动力市场的脆弱令美国消费者感到不安。【原文：US employment growth exceeded forecasts while the jobless rate ticked higher in September, illustrating a tenuous labor market that is unnerving American consumers.】

item.title: 白俄罗斯领导人根据与特朗普达成的协议赦免 31 名乌克兰人
item.description: 作为与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普达成的协议的一部分，白俄罗斯总统亚历山大-卢卡申科赦免了 31 名在前苏联共和国被判有罪的乌克兰人。【原文：Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko pardoned 31 Ukrainians convicted of crimes in the former Soviet republic as part of agreements reached with US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 贝利的历史教训表明里夫斯无力推动增长
item.description: 与许多英国首相一样，雷切尔-里夫斯进入唐宁街时也承诺要重振经济，但迄今为止，她未能带来多大改变。【原文：Like many British chancellors, Rachel Reeves entered Downing Street on a promise to fire up the economy but has failed, so far, to make much difference.】

item.title: 为什么美国的牧场主不断受到挤压？
item.description:
牛肉现在如此昂贵的真正原因。【原文：

The real reason beef is so expensive right now.

】

item.title: 美国牧场主为何不断受到挤压
item.description: 美国的牛群数量已经缩减到几十年来的最小规模，牛肉价格今年也一路飙升，汉堡包和牛排成了关于食品价格上涨的政治辩论的最新热点。在本期节目中，我们将解开国内牛肉供应量下降的根源；从干旱和饲料成本飙升到肉类包装行业整合的持久影响。我们采访了独立养牛场主贸易协会 R-CALF USA 的首席执行官比尔-布拉德（Bill Bullard）、【原文：The country’s cattle herd has shrunk to its smallest size in decades and beef prices have been soaring this year, with hamburgers and steaks becoming the latest flashpoints in the political debate over higher food prices. In this episode, we untangle the roots of declining domestic beef supply — from drought and surging feed costs to the lasting impact of consolidation in the meatpacking industry. We speak with Bill Bullard, CEO of R-CALF USA, a trade association for independent cattle ranchers,】

item.title: 尼日利亚在数天内大规模扣押学生后关闭学校
item.description: 本周，尼日利亚接连发生数百名儿童被绑架的事件，导致数十所学校停课。【原文：Nigeria has shut dozens of schools following a spate of abductions that saw hundreds of children kidnapped this week.】

item.title: 瑞士监管机构警告抵押贷款存在修正风险：Blick
item.description: 瑞士金融监管机构 Finma 负责人在接受《Blick》报采访时说，在房价回调风险日益增大之际，瑞士一些银行在审批抵押贷款时过于宽松。【原文：Some banks in Switzerland are overly lax in approving mortgages at a time when there’s a growing risk of a correction in houses prices, the head of Swiss financial regulator Finma said in an interview with Blick newspaper.】

item.title: S&P因赞比亚债务重组取得进展而取消其违约评级
item.description: S&P全球评级公司取消了对赞比亚的违约评级，五年前，赞比亚未能在2020年支付美元债券，成为非洲第一个大流行病时期的主权违约国。【原文：S&P Global Ratings removed its default rating for Zambia, five years after the country missed a dollar bond payment in 2020 and became Africa’s first pandemic-era sovereign defaulter.】

item.title: TPG 和华平投资公司考虑 5 亿美元入股根植印度的 Sirion 公司
item.description: 据知情人士透露，TPG Capital LP 和 Warburg Pincus 正在就收购 Sirion Labs Pvt.【原文：TPG Capital LP and Warburg Pincus are in early talks to buy a stake in Sirion Labs Pvt., a Partners Group Holding AG-backed software business managing and automating contracts, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 凯雷投资的国防承包商撤回 23 亿美元贷款出售计划
item.description: 据知情人士透露，由于需求疲软，国防和网络安全承包商ManTech International Corp.取消了原计划的23亿美元杠杆贷款出售计划，转而选择从私人信贷机构融资。【原文：Defense and cybersecurity contractor ManTech International Corp. scrapped a planned $2.3 billion leveraged loan sale amid weak demand, according to people with knowledge of the matter, opting to raise funds from private credit lenders instead.】

item.title: 茶叶大亨迎娶太阳能女继承人的中国上流社会婚礼
item.description: 一位茶叶连锁店企业家和一位太阳能电池板女继承人的婚礼将为人们提供一个难得的机会，一窥中国下一代超级富豪的风采。【原文：The wedding of a tea-shop chain entrepreneur and a solar-panel heiress is set to offer a rare glimpse into the next generation of China’s ultra-wealthy.】

item.title: 五张图表显示日本债券和日元压力增大
item.description: 日本市场经历了动荡的一周，首相佐那江隆一的庞大开支计划引发的担忧令日元和政府债券承压。【原文：Japanese markets have had a turbulent week as both the yen and government bonds were pressured by fears sparked by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s large spending plans.】

item.title: 日本高市面临从日元到股票和债券的市场考验
item.description: 市场对日本新首相佐那江隆一失去了热情，在过去一周里，东京上市股票的价值被抹去了约 1,270 亿美元，日元和政府债券也大幅下跌。【原文：Markets have lost their enthusiasm for Japan’s new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi, with about $127 billion wiped off the value of Tokyo-listed stocks over the past week and sharp declines in the yen and government bonds.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称比尔-阿克曼为 2026 年潘兴广场首次公开募股做准备
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》援引不愿透露姓名的知情人士的话报道，亿万富翁对冲基金经理比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）正在加紧实施一项期待已久的计划，即为旗下的潘兴广场资本管理公司（Pershing Square Capital Management）举行首次公开募股。【原文：Billionaire hedge fund manager Bill Ackman is revving up a long-anticipated plan to hold an initial public offering for his Pershing Square Capital Management, the Financial Times reported, citing unidentified people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: Canva 的 Obrecht 称公司计划在 "未来几年内 "进行 IPO
item.description: Canva Inc.是澳大利亚最受瞩目的初创公司，其创始人之一表示，随着该公司向上市公司上市迈进，其新产品套件的用户数量激增。【原文：Canva Inc., Australia’s most high profile startup, has had a surge in users of its new product suite as it builds toward listing as a public company, one of its founders said.】

item.title: 博雅大厦获得芝加哥自 Covid 以来最大一笔抵押债券交易
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，芝加哥美国银行大厦的抵押贷款正在以 7 亿美元的债券进行再融资，这对该市疲软的房地产市场来说是一个难得的亮点。【原文：A mortgage loan for Chicago’s Bank of America Tower is being refinanced with $700 million in bonds, a rare bright spot for the city’s beaten-down real estate market, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 股市反弹，对冲基金争相回补空头头寸
item.description: 对冲基金在股市两天的剧烈波动中陷入困境，周四急于防止损失，但一天后随着股价回落，这些头寸又被平仓。【原文：Hedge funds were caught on the wrong side of a sharp two-day swing in the stock market, rushing to protect against losses on Thursday only to unwind those positions a day later as prices snapped back.】

item.title: RTX 合资企业赢得在美国生产铁穹导弹的合同
item.description: RTX 公司和以色列国防公司拉斐尔（Rafael）宣布，合资企业赢得了一份价值 12.5 亿美元的合同，将在阿肯色州的一家新工厂为以色列的铁穹防空系统制造地对空导弹。【原文：RTX Corp. and Israeli defense firm Rafael have won a $1.25 billion contract to build surface-to-air missiles for Israel’s Iron Dome air-defense system at a new plant in Arkansas, the joint venture announced.】
